messages: cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:05): <map ...><area><area .../> doesn't work in firefox
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:11): seems that only Firefox implies </address> at <table> and <ol>/<ul> ...
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:11): firefox implies </address>?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:12): didn't know
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:12): I was wondering whether the <address> content model had legacy reasons
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:12): doesn't seem like it has in IE7 and O9
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:23): also div, address, dl, center...probably others too
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:23): blockquote
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:26): hr, li, menu, pre, fieldset, form
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:27): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: address does allow tables in address though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:27): sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:27): it would be silly otherwise
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:28): seems to be that Ben Boyle thought it didn't
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:29): oh, allowing it in the parser I meant
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:29): didn't check conformance

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:31): Aha, I was wondering if Firefox treated anything else the same as <unknown> in terms of implying end tags, but couldn't think of any, but it looks like <address> is one
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:34): we should preserve wordings that makes readers smile! :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:41): hmm, ie doesn't support coords=default
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:42): yeah, known
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): I think IE parsing was not reverse engineered fully or something
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:44): parsing of what?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:45): s/coords/shape/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:46): coords, I believe it was not really a problem that IE didn't do shape=default
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:47): needs to play more with image maps
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:47): I'd spend time on stuff that causes actual problems :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:48): good question
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:48): seems we apply the areas in the wrong order
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:48): guess most of those sections are sort of covered, just awaiting implementation experience
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:48): i could write test cases for video
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:49): i've avoided that section so far
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:50): parsing of <meta http-equiv=refresh> ? :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:53): http://simon.html5.org/test/html/semantics/area/001.xht
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:53): or actually
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:53): http-equiv in general
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:53): it is implemented differently from what html5 says i think
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:53): browsers really treat the values as if they were http headers
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:54): and Refresh is supported as a real header
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:54): in some browsers, yes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:54): the question is whether they can drop such support
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:54): in which browsers is that not so?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:55): I thought Refresh was only supported by Gecko, actually
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:55): last time i checked i didn't find any browser not supporting it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:55): but i might have done something wrong by then
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:55): interesting
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:56): sees <meta http-equiv> used on more pages than <table>, but doesn't have any way to determine the attribute's values :-(
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:57): assumes content-type and content-language are the 2 top
